Package org.ironmaple.simulation.drivesims

Class BrushlessMotorSim

java.lang.Object
org.ironmaple.simulation.drivesims.BrushlessMotorSim
public class BrushlessMotorSim extends Object

DCMotorSim with Additional Features for Simulating Modern Brushless Motors.

By Team 5516 "IRON MAPLE".

This class extends the functionality of the original `DCMotorSim` to provide additional simulations specific to modern brushless motors. It simulates the following aspects:

  • Friction force on the rotor.
  • Smart current limiting.
  • Brake and coast modes for brushless motors.
  • Simulated encoder readings.

  • Constructor Details

    • BrushlessMotorSim

      public BrushlessMotorSim(edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.DCMotor motor, double gearRatio, double loadIntertiaJKgMetersSquared, double frictionVoltage)

      Constructs a Brushless Motor Simulation Instance.

      Parameters:
      motor - the DCMotor model representing the motor(s) in the simulation
      gearRatio - the gear ratio of the mechanism; values greater than 1 indicate a reduction
      loadIntertiaJKgMetersSquared - the rotational inertia of the mechanism, in kgÂ·mÂ²
      frictionVoltage - the voltage required to overcome friction and make the mechanism move

  • Method Details

    • requestVoltageOutput

      public void requestVoltageOutput(double volts)

      Requests an Output Voltage for the Motor.

      Note: The requested voltage may not always be fully applied due to current limits. For details on current limiting, refer to enableCurrentLimit(double).

      Parameters:
      volts - the requested output voltage for the motor

    • enableCurrentLimit

      public void enableCurrentLimit(double currentLimitAmps)

      Configures a Current Limit for the Motor.

      If the motor's supply current exceeds the specified limit, the motor will reduce its output to prevent exceeding the limit.

      Parameters:
      currentLimitAmps - the maximum allowed current, in amperes

    • disableCurrentLimit

      public void disableCurrentLimit()

      Disables the Current Limit of the Motor.

      This method removes the current limit, allowing the motor to operate without any current restrictions.

    • setMotorBrakeEnabled

      public void setMotorBrakeEnabled(boolean enabled)

      Configures the Zero Power Behavior of the Motor.

      This method sets the motor's zero power behavior, similar to the setZeroPowerBehavior() method for brushless motors.

      When enabled, the motor is set to brake mode; when disabled, the motor is set to coast mode.

      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable brake mode, false to enable coast mode

    • setState

      public void setState(double angularPositionRad, double angularVelocityRadPerSec)

      Sets the Current State of the Motor.

      This method instantly shifts the motor to a given state, setting its angular position and velocity.

      Equivalent to the DCMotorSim.setState(double, double) method.

      Parameters:
      angularPositionRad - the angular position of the motor, in radians
      angularVelocityRadPerSec - the angular velocity of the motor, in radians per second

    • update

      public void update(double dtSeconds)

      Updates the Simulation.

      This method steps the motor simulation forward by a given time interval (dt), recalculating and storing the states of the motor.

      Equivalent to LinearSystemSim.update(double).

      Parameters:
      dtSeconds - the time step for the simulation, in seconds

    • constrainOutputVoltage

      public static double constrainOutputVoltage(edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant.DCMotor motor, double motorCurrentVelocityRadPerSec, double currentLimitAmps, double requestedOutputVoltage)

      Constrains the Output Voltage of the Motor.

      This method constrains the output voltage of the motor to ensure it operates within the current limit and does not exceed the available voltage from the robot's system.

      The output voltage is constrained such that the motor does not function outside of the specified current limit. Additionally, it ensures that the voltage does not exceed the robot's input voltage, which can be obtained from RoboRioSim.getVInVoltage().

      Parameters:
      motor - the DCMotor that models the motor
      motorCurrentVelocityRadPerSec - the current velocity of the motor's rotor (geared), in radians per second
      currentLimitAmps - the configured current limit, in amperes. You can configure the current limit using enableCurrentLimit(double).
      requestedOutputVoltage - the requested output voltage
      Returns:
      the constrained output voltage based on the current limit and system voltage

    • getAppliedVolts

      public double getAppliedVolts()

      Obtains the Voltage Actually Applied to the Motor.

      This method returns the voltage that is actually applied to the motor after being constrained by constrainOutputVoltage(DCMotor, double, double, double).

      The voltage is constrained to ensure that the current limit is not exceeded and that it does not surpass the robot's battery voltage.

      Returns:
      the constrained voltage actually applied to the motor

    • getAngularPositionRad

      public double getAngularPositionRad()

      Obtains the Angular Position of the Mechanism.

      This method is equivalent to DCMotorSim.getAngularPositionRad().

      Returns:
      the final angular position of the mechanism, in radians

    • getEncoderPositionRad

      public double getEncoderPositionRad()

      Obtains the Angular Position of the Motor.

      Returns:

      Returns:
      the final angular velocity of the mechanism, in radians per second

      public double getEncoderVelocityRadPerSec()

      Obtains the Angular Velocity of the Encoder.

      Returns:
      the un-geared angular velocity of the motor (encoder velocity), in radians per second

      Obtains the Amount of Current Flowing into the Motor.

      This method is equivalent to DCMotorSim.getCurrentDrawAmps().

      Returns:
      the amount of current flowing into the motor, in amperes
